intro: Alstroemeria graminea, commonly known as the grassy alstroemeria, is a perennial herb native to South America. It features slender, grass-like foliage and produces clusters of striking, tubular flowers in shades of red, orange, and yellow. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and thrives in well-drained soil with full sun to partial shade. Its flowers bloom in late summer to early autumn, making it a popular choice for gardens and floral arrangements. Alstroemeria graminea is also valued for its air-purifying qualities and ability to attract pollinators.
